title: What Does a Yellow Moon Mean? (Plus, the Science Behind It)

steps.title: Abundance
steps.content: Abundance If you see a yellow moon during the autumnal equinox (usually around September 23rd in the Northern Hemisphere), it’s known as the harvest moon. [1] X Research source The harvest is a time of abundance, as farmers reap the rewards they’ve sown to plant and tend to their crops. Take a moment to appreciate all of the abundance in your own life when you spot the golden glow of the harvest moon.

steps.title: Prosperity
steps.content: Prosperity The yellow moon signifies good fortune. Count your blessings and take pride in all areas of your life that are thriving. Hard works pays off, and now’s the time to sit back and enjoy your success.

steps.title: Balance
steps.content: Balance During the autumnal equinox, day and night are of equal length, lending balance to light and dark. [2] X Research source This time also brings balance to life, allowing you to dedicate time to work and play, productivity and rest.

steps.title: Positivity
steps.content: Positivity The color yellow is often associated with sunshine, joy, and energy. [3] X Research source So, it’s no wonder a yellow moon is a symbol of positivity! Look for the silver lining and rejoice in all the little things that make life a wonderful experience.

steps.title: Gratitude
steps.content: Gratitude When you spot a golden moon, pause and take a moment to be grateful for all of life’s blessings. Even when times are tough, there are still things to be grateful for—from that rich cup of coffee to get your day started or the green traffic lights on your way to work to the health of yourself and loved ones or a recent promotion, savor the good things.

steps.title: Optimism
steps.content: Optimism The yellow color of the moon invokes feelings of joy and optimism. [4] X Research source Just as the moon cycles through phases, so do we all, and it’s a reminder that good things are coming, even if they are tough right now.

steps.title: Renewal
steps.content: Renewal As the moon rises and sets daily, it reminds us that every day is a new chance to be our best selves and meet our goals. Let a yellow moon inspire you to renew your faith and optimism and meet challenges head-on.

steps.title: Acceptance
steps.content: Acceptance Life isn’t perfect, and there are a lot of things we can’t change, but a yellow moon is a reminder to accept things for what they are. If something’s within your control, of course you can put in the effort to make it what you want it to be, but if it’s not, give it up to the universe. It has your best interests at heart, and you may find peace in surrendering.

steps.title: Connection
steps.content: Connection When you see a golden moon, let it be a reminder to connect with your loved ones. Share a meal from this year’s harvest, enjoy a drink around a campfire, and celebrate the people in your life that bring you happiness and share your sorrows.

steps.title: Hard work
steps.content: Hard work Now’s the time to go after what you want. Put in the effort to make your dreams a reality and let the golden glow of the moon inspire you to persevere. Though life is full of challenges, we can overcome them with dedication and determination.

steps.title: Release
steps.content: Release If you’re holding a grudge or hanging onto to negative emotions, let them go under the yellow moon. Forgive yourself and others and move forward with purpose. Don’t look back—you’re not going that way.

steps.title: Deceit
steps.content: Deceit While many of the meanings of a yellow moon are positive, this one is is a warning. In some cultures, yellow is associated with betrayal and dishonesty. [5] X Research source If you have a feeling someone in your life might not being straightforward with you, trust your gut and proceed with caution.

steps.title: Meditate to gain peace.
steps.content: Meditate to gain peace. Turn your focus inward, release negative thoughts, and set positive intentions for the future. To meditate , choose a quiet, calm location, sit in a comfortable position, and focus—the goal is not actually to empty your mind, but to narrow it on a particular focus. You might focus on your breath or repeat a mantra or intention. If your mind wanders, gently direct it back to your focus. [6] X Research source Try an intention or mantra such as “I am at peace,” “I attract abundance,” “I am filled with positivity,” or “I accept myself.”

steps.title: Manifest your desires.
steps.content: Manifest your desires. To manifest , simply focus on the things you want. Visualize what you hope to achieve, whether that’s a successful career or fulfilling relationship, then take steps to obtain what you desire. You might look for new job opportunities or focus on improving communication with your partner, for instance. Stay positive, believe in the power of abundance, and keep working to achieve your goals. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Perform a ritual.
steps.content: Perform a ritual. Harness the power of the celestial by doing a full moon ritual . Sleep under the moon, take a full moon bath, charge your crystals, or do a smoke cleanse. [8] X Research source Invite positivity and peacefulness into your life during a golden moon.

steps.title: Make positive changes in your life.
steps.content: Make positive changes in your life. Now might be the perfect time to shake things up. If a relationship isn’t working for you, break things off. If you’ve been wanting to move to a new city, take the leap. It can definitely feel scary, but remind yourself that you’re capable of handling anything that comes your way. [9] X Research source

steps.title: The moon looks yellow when it’s near the horizon or because of pollution.
steps.content: The moon looks yellow when it’s near the horizon or because of pollution. When the moon is low in the sky, its light travels farther and more of the blue wavelengths scatter. That leaves more of the red wavelengths visible to the eye. Additionally, dust and pollution in the atmosphere can lend more of a yellow tint to the moon. [10] X Research source A harvest moon is a full moon that occurs right around the autumnal equinox. The name refers to the farmers’ harvest period, in which they used to rely on the light of the full moon before electricity enabled people to see and work after dark. [11] X Research source
